Hi Carl,

>    hey,i was just lookin at the shogun page

Hope you enjoyed it, it is supposed to be fun after all:-)

>hahaha coincidentally did 
>    you know that mr hayes,was actually an actor in the original movie 
>    shogun?no bs

No I didn't, but then the series isn't history either, it's just a great
romp, plus it's what got me started down the road to real Japanese
history, as with so many others of us in the West. So I have personally
a great debt of gratitude to Clavell for writing it, I just wish he'd
followed the original story a wee bit closer!

>.oh,and the photo of the samurai playing go....samurai 
>    would not sit like that.atleast not in the presence of others.

Yep, can't fault you on that one, you're absolutely right, but I'm old,
grey haired, grumpy, and my knees no longer like being sat on, plus
after many years of wearing combat boots, my ankles object to bending
quite that far. And besides, it had been a long hot day and my old bones
just wanted to go flomp on the deck. And to cap it all, I'm virtually
blind, and if I sat properly I'd never be able to see the board, mind
you it wouldn't have made much difference to the outcome of that
particular game:-) Seppuku anybody?

Yours

Dean

P.S. For those who don't know what Carl is referring to when he say's
"Shogun page", see my link below and all will be revealed.
